caption:
This photograph presents a striking contrast between foreground and background elements, capturing a scene of urban decay juxtaposed against a city skyline. In the foreground, there's a large pile of debris and garbage, including twisted metal, scraps, and possibly remnants of machinery or demolished structures. The debris is chaotic and has an organic, neglected appearance, indicating it might have been there for some time.

The background offers a starkly different view, showcasing the iconic Manhattan skyline. Prominently featured are the Twin Towers of the World Trade Center, standing tall and undamaged, suggesting that the photo was taken before the events of September 11, 2001. The skyscrapers are bathed in sunlight and dominate the skyline, serving as a symbol of economic power and architectural achievement.

Between these two contrasting elements, there are electrical transmission towers and lines running through the middle ground, further emphasizing the theme of industrial activity and urban infrastructure. The air appears somewhat hazy, possibly due to pollution or distant smog, which adds a layer of atmospheric depth to the scene. This photograph captures a moment in time, contrasting human-made environmental impact with the resilience and ambition represented by the city's towering structures.
title: Illegal dumping area off the New Jersey turnpike, facing Manhattan across the Hudson River.  Nearby, to the south, is the landfill area of the proposed liberty state park
